value.name: (#67) Selected surahs from the Qur'an, signed by 'Abdullah al-Sayrafi ...
value.snippet: 'Abdullah al-Sayrafi’s calligraphy was held in such respect in the fifteenth century that his style was followed by the scribe Jafar Tabrizi, a tutor of 'Abdullah Haravi and confidant of Prince Baysunghur, the well-known Timurid bibliophile.

value.name: A CALLIGRAPHIC PANEL - Christie's
value.snippet: SIGNED 'ABDULLAH AL-SAYRAFI, TABRIZ, DATED 20 RABI' I AH 726/4 MARCH 1326 AD Arabic manuscript on paper, with 2ll. of strong black thuluth above 12ll. of smaller flowing riq'a, laid down between minor gold and maroon borders on blue and orange marbled margins, signed and dated Calligraphy 15 x 6 7/8in. (38.4 x 17.2cm.); folio 19 3/8 x 11in.

value.snippet: Juz 30 - Quran.com 078surah Translation by Dr. Mustafa Khattab, the Clear Quran (Change) Surah Info Play Audio 78:1 عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ ١ What are they asking one another about? 78:2 عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ ٢ About the momentous news, 78:3 ٱلَّذِي هُمۡ فِيهِ مُخۡتَلِفُونَ ٣ over which they disagree. 1 78:4 كـَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ ٤ But no!

value.name: The 30 Juz of Al-Quran – Wajibad
value.snippet: The most commonly memorized juz is juzʾ amma, which is the 30th juz and contains chapters (sura) 78 through 114, most of the shortest chapters of the Quran. Juzʾ amma is named after the 1st word of the 1st chapter (chapter 78) in that juz. Muslims from South Asia also refer to a juz as a para or paaro.

value.name: (PDF) A Unique Qur’an Manuscript Copied by Abdullah al-Sayrafi (d ...
value.snippet: Abdullah al-Sayrafi is one of the most distinguished calligraphers of the 8th and 9th H/14th and 15th AC centuries who followed the way of Yaqut al-Musta'simi (d. 698H/1298AC) and helped spreading it in the eastern part of the Islamic world.
